pull.title: Update about logo icon (colour) to denote the chain type of the QT instance in About/ Help Message Window/ Dialog
pull.body:
It fixes https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/issues/761.

About logo icon is updated now with the correct colour indicating the chain type of the QT instance that user is running (as the splash screen), plus the title of the about window also is updated with the chain type string as in the main window.
<details>
<summary>Before PR changes screenshot</summary>

![image](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/assets/110166421/63945955-2e29-4dc9-8a2e-2a5567983e9b)
</details>

<details>
<summary>After PR changes screenshot</summary>

![image](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/assets/110166421/b6ce187f-ca81-4c4b-b2f6-a2e3b15e6010)
</details>

<details>
<summary>Current splash screen screenshot</summary>
(this hasn't been touched, just to show consistency with this PR changes)


![image](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/assets/110166421/2a1c329b-baa6-4603-bf20-dac2746682f4)
</details>

Tested it also with:
- mainnet (no command line args after `bitcoin-qt` or `bitcoin-qt -chain=main`), 
- `-regtest` and 
- `-testnet`.

It may help to show screenshots before and after

> It may help to show screenshots before and after

Thanks for your review @MarcoFalke, the before screenshot is on the issue #761 but I can bring it here if that makes it clearer.
tested ACK

> It may help to show screenshots before and after

@maflcko I've updated the description with your suggestion (copied @furszy's style from his PR #764, I find it less invasive for the reviewer)
tack 30c235b2e6fd9b7e3634d795cedc171d4d8d0e27
Concept ACK

Tested ACK 30c235b2e6fd9b7e3634d795cedc171d4d8d0e27

![Screenshot from 2023-12-28 16-34-43](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/assets/15610188/9e70728e-6ee9-4981-9c5a-9797d1a8a170)
@GBKS What do you think from a designer's point of view?

Not sure. All info displayed on the About page is fixed details about the software itself, not about the current (test)chain. So modulating the icon or title bar seems confusing, but no strong opinion.
Definitely more consistent this way.

> Not sure. All info displayed on the About page is fixed details about the software itself, not about the current (test)chain.

In that case, shouldn't the logo on the About page be black-toned?

> > Not sure. All info displayed on the About page is fixed details about the software itself, not about the current (test)chain.
> 
> In that case, shouldn't the logo on the About page be black-toned?

I'm less sure about black-toned icons, in that specific case, it's more common usage I guess, users are already used to the orange one.

I think the most notable use case is when you have different instances open and you want to make sure you are standing on the correct one but more importantly the consistency regarding other components such as the splash screen and task-bar icons as pointed by @GBKS.

https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/762#issuecomment-1946005139:
> Definitely more consistent this way.

Thank you @GBKS for your designer's opinion!
If you will touch this branch, mind applying [`clang-format-diff.py`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/contrib/devtools/clang-format-diff.py)?

Updates:
  • Addressed @hebasto's feedback. ``` git diff -U0 HEAD~1.. | ./contrib/devtools/clang-format-diff.py -p1 -i -v Formatting src/qt/bitcoingui.cpp Formatting src/qt/utilitydialog.cpp Formatting src/qt/utilitydialog.h ```
- As part of the above, [functions](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/762#discussion_r1602056777) were re-placed in the `private` section (no in slots as mistaken). - As a consequence of applying the [clang-formatting](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/contrib/devtools/README.md#clang-format-diffpy), @kristapsk's [feedback](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/762#discussion_r1437190084) got addressed as well.

Tested 577d500cb1ac4122fba3202c289454dcbe31a194.

On Windows, there remains some inconsistency. Running `bitcoin-qt.exe -signet -about` ends with a dialog with an orange-coloured icon.

> On Windows, there remains some inconsistency. Running `bitcoin-qt.exe -signet -about` ends with a dialog with an orange-coloured icon.

Let me take a look...

> > On Windows, there remains some inconsistency. Running `bitcoin-qt.exe -signet -about` ends with a dialog with an orange-coloured icon.
> 
> Let me take a look...

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6ce38de9-a5a1-4d09-adfb-3442139db0aa)

Good catch... trying to get it sorted...

Updates: - Addressed @hebasto's feedback. - Fixed the [error message window inconsistency](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/762#issuecomment-2276259183) detected by @hebasto [above](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/762#pullrequestreview-2219281894).
Now running qt from the command line with bitcoin-qt.exe -signet -about (or similar command with an invalid argument) will show the correct chain type icon at the top left of the title bar (this is only happening in Windows at the moment). ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d5dd5959-12c1-4278-9b5d-349cb55a7755)

events.message:
gui: Update about logo icon to denote chain type

Adding the networkStyle parameter to the HelpMessageDialog
creator on utilitydialog, updating all calls where its instance
is being created from bitcoingui.cpp. In the object itself,
use this new parameter object to build the about window title and
set the icon of the about logo widget.

Also, set th correct chain type icon at the very beginning of
GuiMain() where command line arguments were validated and most of
the app settings were not initialised yet.

events.body: Rebased.

comments.body: Why would this be nullptr? Seems easier to use a reference that is never null?

I didn't want to touch `src/qt/bitcoin.cpp`:

https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/blob/db19a7e89d19d97094bcf8753b37619a16b7f033/src/qt/bitcoin.cpp#L568

And I also needed to move where the `networkStyle` is initialised/ set before the `HelpMessageDialog` constructor:

https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/blob/db19a7e89d19d97094bcf8753b37619a16b7f033/src/qt/bitcoin.cpp#L607

But I can do it if that's better.
Thanks for reviewing! I'll change it if I have to re-touch it.
Why these two member functions are declared as slots?
Sorry, that's wrong, I meant to put them just on the private section. I'll fix it soon. Thanks!

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -29,18 +31,17 @@
 #include <QVBoxLayout>
 
 /** "Help message" or "About" dialog box */
-HelpMessageDialog::HelpMessageDialog(QWidget *parent, bool about) :
-    QDialog(parent, GUIUtil::dialog_flags),
-    ui(new Ui::HelpMessageDialog)
+HelpMessageDialog::HelpMessageDialog(QWidget* parent, bool about, const NetworkStyle* networkStyle) : QDialog(parent, GUIUtil::dialog_flags),
+                                                                                                      ui(new Ui::HelpMessageDialog)
comments.body:
Break the long line for better readability:
```suggestion
HelpMessageDialog::HelpMessageDialog(QWidget* parent, bool about, const NetworkStyle* networkStyle)
    : QDialog(parent, GUIUtil::dialog_flags),
      ui(new Ui::HelpMessageDialog)
```
?
